channel.title: Welcome to Doks on My Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to Doks on My Docs

item.title: Example Post
item.description: You can use blog posts for announcing product updates and features.

item.title: Example Guide
item.description: Guides lead a user through a specific task they want to accomplish, often with a sequence of steps. Writing a good guide requires thinking about what your users are trying to do.

item.title: Docker & Compose 101
item.description:
Goal

Provide a concise reference for essential Docker and Docker Compose commands and explain how Docker‚Äôs build cache works.

Requirements

Tool Why it’s needed
docker CLI for building, running, and managing containers
docker-compose Compose tool for multi-container application stacks
BuildKit (Optional) advanced build cache and mount caching

‚úÖ Docker Engine ‚â• 19.03 for BuildKit support.

item.title: Bot: [short title here]
item.description:
Goal

Explain what this bot is doing, who runs it, and what repo(s) or services it’s tied to.

Bot Requirements

Scope/API Why it’s needed
repo Full control of private repos (issues etc.)
public_repo Public repos only
workflow Dispatch workflows
write:discussion For interacting with GitHub Discussions

‚úÖ Include exact GitHub token scope or GitHub App permission.

item.title: Razor Directive Order in Blazor MAUI
item.description: A consistent Razor directive order makes your components cleaner, reduces bugs, and improves readability‚Äîespecially in hybrid projects like Blazor MAUI.

item.title: Example Reference
item.description: new[] { “FLT”, “üõ´ Flight Bookings”, “View/search/manage all flight bookings (by client, user, PNR, etc.)” }, new[] { “POL”, “üìú Travel Policies”, “View/edit travel policies per client (regions, max cost, cabin class)” }, new[] { “CLT”, “üè¢ Client Management”, “Add/edit clients, contact info, onboarding status, client tags” }, new[] { “USR”, “üë• User Directory”, “View/edit all users per client, reset access, impersonate, audit logs” }, new[] { “PNR”, “üîñ Booking References (PNRs)”, “Lookup active/reserved bookings, check ticketing deadlines, cancellations” }, new[] { “TKT”, “üé´ Ticketing Dashboard”, “View upcoming unpaid ticketing deadlines, auto-expiry, and hold limits” }, new[] { “RCM”, “‚öôÔ∏è Reconciliation Monitor”, “Match Amadeus bookings with internal DB, show mismatches or sync issues” }, new[] { “SUP”, “üõ† Support Tickets”, “View/log/update support tickets across all clients” }, new[] { “SLS”, “üí∞ Sales & Usage Stats”, “Monthly/weekly stats for each client (usage, bookings, savings)” }, new[] { “INV”, “üì¶ Inventory Viewer”, “Lookup available flights, carriers, pricing, capacity constraints” }, new[] { “MAP”, “üó∫Ô∏è Route Map & Regions”, “Visual/textual overview of allowed/disallowed countries per policy” }, new[] { “TRX”, “üìë Transactions & Billing”, “Audit log of all bookings, charges, commission, revenue per client” }, new[] { “NTF”, “üì£ Notifications & Alerts”, “Send test push/email/SMS, manage alert templates & recipients” }, new[] { “ENV”, “üß™ Test Environments”, “Spin up demo clients, simulate bookings, test endpoint health” }, new[] { “DBG”, “üßµ Debug Tools”, “Inspect raw payloads from Amadeus, webhook logs, and sandbox tokens” }, new[] { “ACT”, “üìã Activity Logs”, “Per-client or global: see actions taken by users/admins/support” }, new[] { “AUT”, “üîê Authentication”, “Manage login methods, MFA, token expiration, client SSO configs” }, new[] { “CNF”, “üß∞ Configuration Center”, “Set system-wide toggles, flags, rollout features, default behaviors” }, new[] { “UPD”, “‚¨ÜÔ∏è Update & Patch Notes”, “Show last changes, fixes, deployments, schema versions” }, new[] { “EXT”, “üîö Exit”, “Close application safely” }

item.title: FlightResultV1
Git 101
item.description:
Adding Deleted Files

Action Command
Stage a deleted file git add path/to/file
Remove and stage git rm path/to/file
All deletions git add -u or git add -u path/to/folder

Undoing Commits and Changes

Undo Last Commit (before push)

Undo the commit, but keep changes staged:

item.title: Minimum Requirements

Client Supported Domains

item.title: OpenStreetMap Contribution
item.description: How to correctly display attribution when using OpenStreetMap tiles in a Blazor project, and when to use <div> or <MudText>.
